meanings.sent1: After the storm destroyed the playground, the community rededicated their efforts to rebuild it.
meanings.sent2: The team rededicated their championship trophy to their coach for his unwavering support.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful student rededicated his time to studying after realizing the exam was the next day.
meanings.sent4: She rededicated her life to helping others, like a beacon of hope in a dark world.
meanings.sent5: The old library was rededicated as a community center, breathing new life into the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To commit or devote oneself anew
meanings.sent1: Feeling inspired by the marathon, she rededicated herself to training for the next race.
meanings.sent2: The soldier rededicated his service to his country after a life-changing experience.
meanings.sent3: After a weekend of indulgence, he rededicated himself to his diet and exercise routine.
meanings.sent4: She rededicated her heart to love, opening up to new possibilities and experiences.
meanings.sent5: The artist rededicated himself to his craft, creating masterpieces that captured the soul.

meanings.definition: To pledge or consecrate once more
meanings.sent1: The couple rededicated their vows on their 25th wedding anniversary, reaffirming their love.
meanings.sent2: The temple was rededicated with a special ceremony, honoring its historical significance.
meanings.sent3: The team rededicated their efforts to winning the championship, determined to succeed.
meanings.sent4: She rededicated her faith after a period of doubt, finding solace in prayer.
meanings.sent5: The leader rededicated the organization to its original mission, refocusing on its core values.
